description.narrative: The Power of Voices Partnership (PvP) is an influencing programme with the Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs. The programme FAIR for ALL led by Oxfam Novib is five year long initiative implemented jointly with consortium members Huairou Commission, SOMO and Third World Network-Africa (TWN-Africa) aimed at supporting and collaborating with people’s rightful demands towards companies, governments and multilateral organizations for economic, social and environmental justice, promoting global trade and value-chains that are fair for all. The main focus of the FAIR for ALL programme proposal is to support and strengthen CSOs to play their diverse roles; as educators, mobilizers, creators and watchdogs to make trade and value chains FAIR for ALL. In Brasil, FAIR for ALL programmeaims at empowering rural actors, in particular grassroots women and their organizations, to pursue productive and political autonomy within their communities and key agricultural value chains (sugar cane, fruits, coffee, beef livestock, milk, cocoa, soy and corn). Strengthen civil society and representative organizations to ensure the observance of human rights for people1 impacted by agricultural value chains. The Brasil FAIR for ALL programme will be implemented by Oxfam in Brasil and consortium partners, aiming to: 1)Improving value chains of sugar cane, fruits, coffee, beef livestock, milk, cocoa, soy and corn, increasing accountability of public and private actors and improving access to grievance mechanisms 2) Developing and strengthening local cooperatives to increase theprofits, knowledge and capacities of agricultural smallholders focused on agroecological practices in the northeast of the country 3) Addressing exploitation, violence and human rights violations inagricultural value chains. Research on cost and value distribution in value chains 4) Addressing reduction of civic space by the current far-right federal government and other actors. These objectives will be achieved by supporting local civil society onadvocacy and influencing opportunities towards public and private actors. Including the ability to access grievance procedures, judicial procedures and legal documents related to infringements of labour rights and racial and gender discrimination in rural areas; understanding of procedures around certifications, standards and audits of agricultural goods as a tool to ensure observation of rights throughout value chains. Additionally, the programme will support building awareness of local civil society and activists on responsible business conduct, strengthening representative organizations of rural workers to operate at regional, national and international levels and stand against the rolling back of public policies and practices. To achieve main objectives of the programme in Brasil, Oxfam will collaborate with National Confederation for Rural Workers Union (CONTAR); Land Pastoral Commission (CPT); Repórter Brasil.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam International is a confederationorganisations working together in more than 94 countries to find lasting solutions to poverty, suffering and injustice. Oxfam Brazil is one of them. With many of the causes of poverty global in nature, members of Oxfam International believe they can achieve greater impact in addressing issues of poverty by their collective efforts.To achieve the maximum impact on poverty, the Oxfams link up their work on development programs, humanitarian response, lobbying for policy changes at national and global level. The Oxfams popular campaigns and communications work is aimed at mobilising public opinion for change. Oxfam Brazil is a global and Brazilian civil society organization that works together with and mobilizes people, groups, organizations and institutional bodies. It makes political alliances, encourages the convergence of actors, provides financial support, conducts research, produces, disseminates and brokers knowledge, informing public opinion and mobilizing citizens and organizations to leverage change. It wants to change the conditions that generate and perpetuate inequality and poverty, while respecting the sustainability of the planet.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
